result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Andrew S Uick

records.addlTxt: from Racine County Alternatives Program - Incident Report
Plea/sentencing hearing on November 14, 2022 at 09:15 am.

1:37 PM Defendant Andrew S Uick in court, in custody.  Attorney Joe Edward Kremkoski in court for Andrew S Uick.  Prosecuting attorney Matthew W Kline in court for the State of Wisconsin. DAR Court Reporter: Taryn Strickland. 
Defense has filed a bond motion in case 22CM1061.
Defense is requesting that the cash bond be converted to a signature bond.
State will not object to a signature bond as long as there is no contact with the victim.
The victim does not object to allowing a third party to come and get the Deft's belongings.
BTC: Modify bond in case 22CM1061 to a $500 signature bond, all conditions remain, matters adjourned.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 14, 2022 at 09:15 am.
Status conference on September 27, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

9:29 AM Defendant Andrew S Uick in court, in custody.  Attorney Joe Edward Kremkoski in court for Andrew S Uick.  Prosecuting attorney Diane M. Donohoo in court for the State of Wisconsin. DAR Court Reporter: Taryn Strickland. 
Defense indicates he has a conflict and needs to w/draw from in one of the files and is moving to w/draw on all files.
State will defer to the Court.
BTC: Atty is allowed to w/draw on all files effective tomorrow, new SPD to be appointed.
Defense indicates they need a global offer in all the files.
State indicates Defense could see if the former client objects to counsel representing the deft.
Defense likes that idea.
BTC: Will w/draw the Order atty may w/draw, matters adjourned.
Status conference scheduled for September 27, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Andrew S Uick

letter from defendant requesting bond hearing and plea.
atty Kremkoski
State's Notice of Intent to introduce certified public records w/o extrinsic evidence
State's Notice of Intent to introduce 911 recordings
DA AUTHORIZATION TO OBTAIN COPIES OF CERTAIN EVIDENCE

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit. It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any alcohol or controlled substances. This is to be monitored through random drug screens and/or breathalyzers by the Racine County Alternatives Program, Room MC340 (Law Enforcement Center 717 Wisconsin Ave Racine WI 53403). New referrals from Court must report on the day of their Court appearance.  Jail releases must report the following business day (M-Fr 8am-4:30pm).  In addition to random testing, the defendant is further ordered to test after each court appearance.

2:05 PM Prosecuting attorney Matthew W Kline in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Andrew S Uick appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney McKenna Marie Quinter appeared by video for Andrew S Uick. Court Reporter Mark Garvin. 
Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, p-ng, bond set.
Status conference scheduled for September 20, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Status conference on September 20, 2022 at 08:30 am.
